Skeletons are a common undead monster found all over Gielinor. Like zombies, they are the result of a necromancer reanimating the bodies of the dead. As such, they are commonly found in tombs, graveyards and dungeons.

According to Azzanadra, skeletons can also reanimate themselves should their burial site be desecrated, which is further supported when attempting to loot fallen barbarian corpses in the Ancient Cavern.

They are generally weak to magic, with most skeletons being especially vulnerable to earth or water spells. A salve amulet or salve amulet (e) will provide a damage and accuracy boost of +15% and +20% respectively against skeletons and other undead.

Slayer alternatives[edit | edit source]

Any monsters named "skeleton", with the exception of guard skeletons in a player-owned house and the Skeletons found in Daemonheim (also including the Unholy Cursebearer boss) and Sinkholes, may be killed to complete a slayer assignment. The following alternatives are also available:

  • Bound skeletons
  • Skeleton mages
  • Skeletal miners
  • Skeletal hands
  • Skeleton Fremenniks
  • Skeleton warlords
  • Skoblins

Banking tips[edit | edit source]

Many skeleton locations are far from banks. For players wishing to slay skeletons and bank their drops, consider the following:

  • The Draynor Sewers are moderately close to the Draynor Village bank.
  • The Lair of Tarn Razorlor has a banker. However, using this dungeon requires the Haunted Mine quest, Lair of Tarn Razorlor miniquest, and a 100 coin payment to the banker for each access to the bank.
  • The skeleton cave in the Chaos Tunnels is easily accessed from entrance #1 to tunnels and is thus moderately close to the Edgeville bank. However, care should be taken in that entrance #1 is in low-level Wilderness and also enters the cave with rather dangerous Gargoyles. Aggressive Zombies in the cave with the skeletons may interfere with skeleton hunting.
  • Skeletal Hands may also be slain in the Meiyerditch Dungeon if the player looking for good drops from skeletons.

Champion's Challenge[edit | edit source]

Skeletons are one of the races who have lesser champions in the Champion's Challenge Distraction and Diversion. To fight the Skeleton Champion, the player must kill skeletons until one drops a Champion's scroll, a very rare drop. Obtaining the scroll usually takes several hours of dedicated skeleton hunting, therefore it is advised to kill lower level skeletons to increase the kill rate as much as possible.

Update history[edit | edit source]

This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
  • patch 15 May 2023 (Update):
    • Updated models for skeletons, zombies and giant rats within the Wilderness, giving them the new Unwelcome Guests models.
  • patch 11 April 2023 (Update):
    • Skeletons can be killed as part of the new undead slayer task.
  • ninja 2 March 2015 (Update):
    • A large number of skeletons across Gielinor have been graphically updated.
  • patch 16 February 2015 (Update):
    • Some skeletons no longer shoot rocks out of their bows.
  • patch 5 July 2010 (Update):
    • The new skeletons and goblins in the Lumbridge Catacombs can now also drop champion scrolls.
  • patch 9 November 2009 (Update):
    • Reworked various zombie and skeleton combat animations.
  • patch 7 October 2009 (Update):
    • Updated the skull of a skeleton to match the rest of its, er, body.
  • update 22 January 2007 (Update):
    • Zombies, skeletons and ghosts have been graphically updated.
  • update 4 January 2001 (Update):
    • Added to game.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The level 58 skeletons in the Crandor and Karamja Dungeon are bigger than the other skeletons.
  • The skeletons in the Barrows did not drop the champion scroll for several years. This bug was eventually fixed.
  • When in a player-owned-house oubliette or dungeon when building mode is on, they are called Bones.
  • In the 2011 Halloween event, the player has to choose a skeleton to represent Pestilence in statue form.
